page.title: 16ROSE QUEEN
page.content: History of Gawsworth Rose Queen. In Gawsworth we have a Rose Queen in the summer.All of us in school vote for a girl and she is crowned as Queen.We have a procession through the village and all the girls wear pretty dresses. There has been a Rose Queen in Gawsworth since 1929, then it was a girl called Daisy Hadfield, then everyone from the school walked in a procession to Gawsworth Hall, past the Church to a field by the Harrington Arms where the Queen was crowned.Then the children did dancing and had tea in a big tent. Later the Queen was crowned in the Parish Hall Now they are crowned on the school field and we walk there from the Parish Hall. Our Queen this year was a girl called Katie Hogg. Written by Patricia Heyworth.
